definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: Her shoes clicked against the floor as she walked.
sentences.chinese: 她走動時，鞋在地板上咔噔咔噔作響。

sentences.english: Her shoes clicked against the floor as she walked.
sentences.chinese: 她走動時，鞋在地板上咔噔咔噔作響。

sentences.english: He stomped out of the room in high dudgeon .
sentences.chinese: 他憤怒地噔噔走出了屋子。

sentences.english: Little Tom stumped the sitting room with his father's boots.
sentences.chinese: 小湯姆穿着他爸爸的大靴子噔噔地在客廳裏走動。

sentences.english: Little Tom stumped the sitting room with his father's boots.
sentences.chinese: 小湯姆穿着他爸爸的大靴子噔噔地在客廳裏走動。

sentences.english: Then I saw a young man run up along the stairs with heavy steps.
sentences.chinese: 只見一個年輕人噔噔噔地順着臺階跑上來，直奔頂端。

sentences.english: Then I saw a young man run up along the stairs with heavy steps.
sentences.chinese: 只見一個年輕人噔噔噔地順着臺階跑上來，直奔頂端。

sentences.english: Then I saw a young man run up along the stairs with heavy steps.
sentences.chinese: 只見一個年輕人噔噔噔地順着臺階跑上來，直奔頂端。

sentences.english: He stomped out of the room in high dudgeon.
sentences.chinese: 他憤怒地噔噔走出了屋子。

sentences.english: She slammed the door and stomped out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 她砰的一聲關上了門，噔噔地走出了屋子。

sentences.english: She slammed the door and stomped out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 她砰的一聲關上了門，噔噔地走出了屋子。

sentences.english: The landlord did not listen to him and turned around up to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 房東不聽他說，轉身“噔噔噔”上了樓。

sentences.english: The landlord did not listen to him and turned around up to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 房東不聽他說，轉身“噔噔噔”上了樓。

definition: sound of an explosion/sound of sth throbbing or bursting
Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) sound of dripping water, a ticking clock etc
